page.title: 02The Church
page.content: East Winch is part of a combined pair of parishes with Middleton, a few miles to the west. Both parishes have their own churches and services are held regularly in both. A new vicar has been appointed to the two parishes recently after a period of about nine months without a minister. The previous minister left the parishes to go to another part of Norfolk in November 1984. The church at East Winch stands on a small mound just beside the main road running through the village. A service is held there every Sunday Behind the organ in the church there are two tablets. Written on these is the story of a man who was faithful to the king during the English Civil War.
